text:
Pulcheria Alexandrovna didn't know what to do without her daughter's support. Finally, she looked at Dounia and admitted that she was very worried about something.

“Dmitri Prokofitch,” she started. “I want to be honest with you, Dounia?”

“Of course, mother,” Dounia replied strongly.

“This is what it is,” she said quickly, as if talking about her problem made her feel lighter. “This morning, we got a note from Pyotr Petrovitch in response to our letter about our arrival. He promised to meet us at the station, but instead, he sent a servant to give us the address of our place and show us the way. He also said he would come himself this morning. But this note came instead. You should read it; there’s something in it that worries me a lot… you’ll see what it is, and… please tell me what you really think, Dmitri Prokofitch! You know Rodya’s character better than anyone, and no one can give us better advice than you. Dounia made her decision right away, but I still don’t know what to do, and I’ve been waiting for your thoughts.”

Razumihin opened the note, which was dated the night before, and read:  
“Dear Madam, Pulcheria Alexandrovna, I want to inform you that due to unexpected problems, I was…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses her worry about Pyotr Petrovitch's unexpected change of plans regarding their meeting.
